Jane Lynch , the 50-year-old actress- who plays scathing cheerleading coach Sue Sylvester on the US TV show- believes there are many similarities between the teacher and the straight-talking talent show judge. She said: If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell . You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her. "He's a great inspiration for the character of Sue- there is a lot that I can take from him and put into her. headteachers say it ignores many academic subjects such as religious studies and the sciences. "All that you're getting is a new Government wanting to put their stamp on education," said Ms McVittie. There have been marked improvements in pass rates over the past decade and what you've got is a Government wanting to get the measure way down at a lower level so they can show some sort of improvement. National figures show just 15.6 per cent of pupils met the Baccalaureate threshold last summer.
